intro: Hyaloseris, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, often blue or purple, ray flowers and bristly, spiny leaves. Hyaloseris species are typically found in coastal and saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. The plants produce small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Their unique morphology and ecological niche make them an important component of coastal flora.
